Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna G
Reviews.Content: This was, without a doubt, the worst hotel experience I've had. I booked a double room, when we arrived we had a room sized about 10' x 10' with two double beds and a single bed. We had to climb over the single bed to get to the wardrobe. We immediately went to Reception to say we thought they'd made a mistake as we'd booked (and received confirmation of) a double room and had obviously got a family room, a room that was only big enough for one double bed and a small wardrobe, the man on duty told us they were full and that was the only room available, despite the 'Vacancies' sign in the window and the fact I'd booked 3 weeks in advance. We just wanted somewhere nice to rest our heads so we thought we'd try and make the best of it and went back to the room. Then we tried to turn the bedside lights on only to find they didn't work, then the switches of the lights came off in ouhands. We decided enough was enough and again went to Reception, this time to complain and ask for a refund. The attitude of the only staff member was beyond belief, he said we had been in the room for half an hour and actually asked my husband "did you use the toilet?" - because apparently that meant we'd "used both rooms"... He came to the door of our room and said "So?", I said I didn't think this was adequate for the price (one hundred pounds) he said there was nothing he could do. He spoke only to my husband, no eye contact with me, the person paying the bill. I asked for a refund, he simply said "No". When I asked him to speak to me, he turned and walked away. Eventually (and this took some time) he agreed to book us into their other hotel in South Kensington, The Eden Plaza, I asked if they would pay for our taxi, again "No" - He was aggressive, rude and unhelpful to the extreme. Happily though, the Eden Plaza in South Kensington, is a great hotel, in a really lovely part of London, with helpful and friendly staff. We found a great Italian restaurant nearby, Carluccios, and had a great night. But the row we had at St George's was a real blip in what was supposed to be a nice, romantic weekend. We did have a nice romantic weekend - but no thanks to this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Agree on "you get what you pay for"”
Reviews.Author: BirutaRiga
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with 8years old kid for 4 nights. I was searching for cheap good location hotel with good enough reviews (most importantly - clean rooms) and this hotel matched these criteria. Overall I was rather satisfied. Location very convenient - 5 minutes walk to Victoria station (underground, busses, trains). It is one of those hotels with paper thin walls.... So huge deal of experience depends on the people living in rooms around you. After first night I was ready to change hotel because our neighbors were very load and I didnt get any sleep. Besides that it is not even possible to close door quietly as hard as you try; so it is rather bad when people next door walk in and out every minute. But other night it was better. I was very glad to see recently renovated wc/shower room - clean and fresh. The towels were changed every day (i just experienced for first time that it was only one towel for person; not other one for the face). Sheets and pillow covers very clean. The room was so tiny that there was no space for the suit case; unfortunately had to put it in the only chair or bed. TV had 3 or 4 channels (I dont care about that). No free wi-fi now; paid 5 pounds for whole stay and it was very slooow; sometimes couldnt get at all. There was very simple breakfast (corn flakes, muesli, yoghurt, orange juice, milk, water, coffee (good), tea, toasted white bread, jam, butter and cheese). And yes - we had a room on the very top floor. On the last day when leaving I was ready to sit down on my heavy suit case and slide down..... lol

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see London from”
Reviews.Author: Blanche G
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here for three nights, found the staff really helpful. At breakfast the first morning, my Mother is a diabetic and can't eat white bread, when I asked for brown bread, there was none available but they had it the next morning, really thoughtful of them to remember this. Our bed linen was changed daily and so were the towels, extra pillows were provided when we asked for them, the staff seemed to go out their way to make our stay a pleasant one. The only negative I had was that the room was a bit small and it was below ground level, I would specify that next time we would ask for a room at ground level or on the first floor! My husband and I will be travelling to London later this year for a few days break and I will most likely book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Good value, but must be able to climb stairs"”
Reviews.Author: Slybacon_48
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and I stayed here for two nights. The location was handy and the St. George Pub close by has great fish and chips. We found the staff quite friendly and the rooms clean. The only downfall was the stairs, I counted 60 steps or so to our room. After a long day of walking it was hard to make it to the top. Needless to say we only returned to our room once through the day for a quick shower before supper.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimmy29
Reviews.Content: on arrival we were instantly told that our booking had been cancelled they said as my card had been declined ... even though when i booked this hotel i was told they would only use this card if i didnt show up .. however he said i could have the room for the 1 night only as he rebooked my second night .i then paid by the card which he said was declined only 2 hours earlier and had to think about finding a hotel for my second night !!! which i did next door at the stanley house hotel . the room that i booked was a double and when we got in it was a double with a single also we could hardley get between the beds . the on suite was small but clean . breakfast was as stated continental , cereal toast and jam . next doorfor the same money we had full english .

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: dariopanda
Reviews.Content: I spent just one Night in a single room. Small, as typical in london, but clean and provided with comforts and, moreov, free wifi! Front desk professional, although not really joyfull. I would suggest for travel workers on for who wants to spend few days in London. No lift available.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kuttappi
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel and is within walking distance of Victoria. I found the front office and the cleaning staff to be very helpful. I stayed for 4 nights and decided to arrive earlier than planned. They were very helpful and tried to arrange a room for me at the nearby hotel and finally found a room. The rooms are quite small but clean. The staff at the breakfast place was also very helpful. The only reason I have given a low overall rating is because its a budget hotel with basic facilities. However when on a limited budget I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: prashantholidayzone
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great location and reasonable price..its realy value for money...but staff is very egoistic...management should train them to be polite and helpful..u can stay here if looking for lower budget hotel..its neat and clean..everything is in order

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 or 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: Powell175
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night as we were going to see the Jersey Boys (which was excellent). Hotel only 5 minutes walk from Victoria Station so very handy for theatres and sight seeing. Room was small, but very clean and tidy. Bed comfortable. On-suite bathroom nice and clean with a good shower. only bad points were that bedside lamps did not work, powdered milk for the tea and coffee in the rooms. Breakfast was very basic as only options were cereal, white sliced bread for toast with jam or cheese, some yoghurts and tea and coffee. Staff very friendly. We would stay again for 1 night as reasonable for London prices.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE !”
Reviews.Author: peterbritton
Reviews.Content: This is the most horrible place I have ever stayed in. The so called double room was not even big enough to be classed as a single. No room for any cases in this room, the "hotel" offer a room for luggage, and charge another £5 for this. We stayed in room 221, it is accessed after 9 flights of stairs! There is no lift. Breakfast is served between 7.30 & 9am. That for me is clearly designed so theat a lot of people will miss it. WiFi is available at £5 extra per room per night! Finally, when u consider this hotel carries the name of our patron saint, they provide NO MILK for your morning tea, just powdered whitener. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff!”
Reviews.Author: memoid
Reviews.Content: During our stay at St George's Inn Victoria - we were very much in doubt: Should we cry or laugh? We ended up the latter... The reception staff have refined the art of beind churlish to a degree I don't remember to have experienced in a hotel before. - And allways served with a little strained smile... Actually too bad... The hotel's location is good, the rooms are small but very clean and the breakfast is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean and affordable place”
Reviews.Author: mspiyali
Reviews.Content: The best part of staying in this hotel is its location. Its near to Victoria Station of Central London. One can see many tourist attractions walking around. The hotel is clean and caters to basic needs. It's a budget hotel and a clean bed, room and shower made my day. The complimentary breakfast was basic and would be improved. The staff were friendly and helpful at the reception. on the second day, the main light of my room was not working. They apologized and immediately shifted me to another room (which was a three bed big room). So on 2nd day I stayed in a big room by default in the same price! If you are looking for a basic place to sleep peacefully at night and spend most of time seeing London, this hotel is indeed a good option!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: rides
Reviews.Content: Myself, fiancee and family stayed here in April. I was taking part in the London Marathon and location wise, Victoria is ideal. However, the climb (we counted 82 steps) to the room was a bit of a challenge, even before i ran 26 miles! The rooms were very small. No problem with that though, for a 2 night stay we were not expecting massive rooms. Shower head was broken but temp of water and pressure of shower fine. Not dirty but not spotless cleanliness wise.As expected i guess. We paid £160 for 2 nights. A little expensive and probably get cheaper locally. Breakfast was fine. Waitresses speak little English but at the end of the day i hardly wanted a topic of conversation with them. They dealt with our small request fine and with a smile on their faces. Second morning we were lucky timing wise, as we sat down a big cue of people formed as the breakfast area is small. Get down early as poss. On the whole we had a good weekend, which wasnt spoilt or made by this accommadation so if you require an average base then this is ok as Location is good. Paul

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynniepoppins
Reviews.Content: I really feel this should be rated as a bed and breakfast and definately not a hotel - and not a quality bed and breakfast at that!!!! The rooms are so small both my partner and myself were unable to get dressed at the same time as there was not enough floor space to do so. We were located at the highest point of the hotel which was 72 steps up to the attic where there were four rooms located - probably all equally as small as ours. The temperature up in the attic was so hot we had to sleep (or attempt to) with the window open to even get some air. When we asked if we could be moved to a room on a lower floor we were advised quite abruptly that there were no other rooms available - however the door sign clearly stated Vacancies available. Breakfast was apalling - only yoghurt (not quality yoghurt either) and toast was available and the room for breakfast was so cramped you might just as well been sat on the table next to you. During cleaning times it was a complete health hazard on the stair as the the staff left bedding, vacuums with trailing cables across the stairwell which someone could easily of tripped over. We ended up moving to another hotel for the second night of our stay as we were unable to stay there any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Not much nice to say”
Reviews.Author: pontificator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at inexpensive hotels all over the world and this was one of the poorest. The staff really struggled with basic English or perhaps hid behind language problems. Our tiny double room was up a brutal small winding staircase in a baking attic (even mid winter). It was expensive for the area, had no shampoo or other conveniences. the room was however clean. They almost made is miss our plane by forgetting the requested wake up call. The bed was like an ironing board. All in all my first bad reviews of the 28 I've completed for trip advisor. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ollie123R
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels in London. The most unfriendly and rude staff I have ever met. A complete rip off for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager, Noisy Basement Room, Great Location so choose another hotel in the same area”
Reviews.Author: us2cameos
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night deal through St George's site and were punished by being given the basement room next to the breakfast room that a previous reviewer had commented negatively (quite rightly) on. So as soon as the kitchen staff arrived, their cigarette smoke came into our room and as soon as breakfast guests arrived, our sleep was over due to the noise. The room itself was small - suitcases had to be opened on the bed - but clean, as was the bathroom. Single bed very uncomfortable so no sleep which left me awake to listen to another guest wee, flush the toilet and wash their hands all night long as well as have an enjoyable time in the bathroom with their partner early in the morning! The window looked out onto an alcove where if you hung out the window, you could see the sky above - very claustrophobic. The worst thing was that when I complained about the room location, the manager told me that I had booked a deal and got a good price, so that's the way it was! Expect total rudeness only from him as we watched an American couple be treated with the same flippancy. Also, he attempted to charge me 5 pounds for using the wi-fi even though their site says it's 50p per hour (we only wanted to use it for 10 minutes to check emails). However, a great location within walking distance of everything. Plenty of other hotels on the same street, so would recommend looking for another in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location off Victoria Train station/”
Reviews.Author: dougthemod
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night with my wife and teenage son. I like to think myself as reasonably fit but the trek up2 to 4th floor to our room was an expedition in itself!!! The room was quite cramped with a double and a single squeezed in!! Truth be told, it could do with a lick of paint to spruce it up a tad. Had a quite nice night sleep tho cos of its location, its closer to all ammenities but just off , from the maddening crowd!! The breakfast was fine, lightening fast service, a bit to quick to be honest!!! All in all, it was an enjoyable stay and i would recommend it, but dont be expecting the ritz, because it aint!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you Pack Light!”
Reviews.Author: sparmelee
Reviews.Content: Loved the location because I love to walk, only about a 10 min walk from the Victoria Station. The only thing I did not like was we were on the top floor and they don't have a lift (Elevator) so we had to walk up 8 flights of stairs, 81 stairs to be exact! I'm glad we only had our backpacks as this would be horrible to bring a rolling suit case up all those stairs. The rooms were small but very cozy and worth the price of the room. Breakfast was ok, ordered bacon and got ham but that is the way bacon is over there, Coffee was excellent and you get OJ too!! I was asked if I wanted Cornflakes or OJ thought that was weird not sure if that is what they drink/eat besides OJ? In London & Europe they don't use wash cloths so if you use one make sure you bring one with you or a lou-fa/Sponge. I also didn't really like London very much, to many people and London is kind of dirty and very very expensive! I do recommend the Tower of London though, great place spent about 4 hours there loved it! You can skip everything else! Head to the country side and only spend a day or 2 in the city! Any more time seems like a waste on a horrible city that charge to much for everything except water!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: AndreaGlen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the st george's inn for one night in London and it was more than adequate. Although the room was small it was very clean and the bathroom was quite new looking. Great location, right in the city centre. Breakfast was very basic. Only cereal and toast. If you have trouble with stairs this hotel is not for u. Lots of very steep narrow stairs and no lift. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hotel run by Scam artists and thieves!!!”
Reviews.Author: cdabda
Reviews.Content: We were quoted and charged one rate for 2 people over the phone. Checked with 2 people and paid for the next 2 nights in advance. the following day, the Manager calls to say that we have to pay more because there are 2 people in the room. We refused to pay and he got rude and said 'pay more or leave'. We wanted to confer with our traveling partner ref the booking details but before we could call them (phone system wasn't working properly) in their room, the Manager called back to say that he did charge an extra 50lbs, needless to say we checked out. When we got to the check in/out counter, the Manager had left for the day (disappeared in 15 minutes!!!). When we returned the following morning, we told him (as the credit card company told us) "we want a refund or else we will report this to our Credit Card company". The Manager refused to give any refund and basically said ' let your credit card company deal with it'. Now, when we were checking out, another lady was trying to check in and the clerk was trying to charge her 85lbs for a room with a double bed for only herself. (they were trying to charge us - not for the double bed that was in our room but for having 2 people in the room). We told her that we were checking out because they were scamming us. She followed us out and asked for details and then went to another establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: wideawake11
Reviews.Content: I was ripped off for two nights that I didn't stay here, in fact I refused to stay in this dump at all. When I tried to cancel at first, the very rude and snotty desk person told me there was a 48 hour cancellation policy, so by all rights I should have only paid for one night. When I tried to do the cancellation, the 'manager' wasn't there and was told to come back the next day...where they said the 48 hours notice still held. Total rip off...many nicer hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night , although others in our party stayed longer. Its a great location just a few steps for Oxford Circus and the tube and an easy walk to Regents Park. Unusually for London most of the rooms have good views because the hotel only starts on the 9th floor and there are no obtrusive buildings around. However the whole place is a little bit Fawlty towers. Its ageing a bit and the service is inconsistent. The reason for coming here is the location and the fact that you can get some good deals - but don't expect anything great.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected-A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mlw50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St. George's for two nights. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the bathroom, which appears to have been recently remodeled. The room was very small, but we did not plan to stay in our hotel, rather we came to see London. The breakfast, which is included, was excellent. It included eggs, bacon, sausage, toast and coffee. We had to leave about 3 o'clock in morning in order to catch a flight. The staff arranged for a cab pickup for us. The only downside was that the alarm clock did not work. You also have to go outside to get to the other building for breakfast, although the weather was great when we wre there. Also, no lift - luckily we only had to go up one flight of stairs. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a place to sleep. Nothing fancy, but a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nic1022
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 night stay at St Georges, 4 Adults and 1 child. The hotel is one of the cleanest I have seen in London the decor was very modern and new. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were cleaned everyday we were there. I can't see what people have to complain about this is a basic hotel and does the job i.e a room to sleep. I have stayed in worse hotels. I will be returning to London in March and will definitely be booking here. We had an English breakfast in the morning ok you had to go to the cafe around the corner for your breakfast but so what it was 30 secs away. If you are looking for a budget hotel that is clean then look no further we had a great time and would recommend to anyone apart from people who want everything handed to them on a silver platter!

Reviews.Title: “Horribly rude and ignorant staff”
Reviews.Author: TaurusWales
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance stayed at the St George's Hotel in London, Victoria, for two nights in July 2008. The location of this hotel is excellent, and our room was OK for the price (although TV picture was rubbish and the bed much too soft) but we won't be returning our custom due to the incredible rudeness of the two women, possibly sisters, who apparently run the place. These women number among the least service-minded people we have had the misfortune to meet. They gave us totally false advice on parking (which we thankfully noticed before paying £25 per day!), were impatient and arrogant, ignored any polite greetings, blanked us completely at breakfast and delayed our service until we had to leave without and eat elsewhere. During our futile wait to get served at breakfast we heard one of the women snap at a couple whose child had been waiting for his breakfast so long that the parents had already eaten. I recommend this hotel only if you are immune to outright bad manners and do not mind being treated like the worst kind of inconvenience having paid a significant sum of money on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent stay at St George's Hotel Belgrave road London”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nfreak
Reviews.Content: London 17th-20th April 2008 We were suprised to enter this great room, new furnuture and completely new clean bathroom, I can really recommend room no 214. The perfect location just a few minutes walk from Vicoria station was great considering our late arrival, the best Hotel I´ve ever stayed at for such a human cost. Having to eat breakfast at a separate cafe nearby just made it more different in a positive sense. Friendly staff as well!! Greetings from two very pleased vistitors from sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Not soo bad”
Reviews.Author: Stella_Italiana15
Reviews.Content: HI! The hotel is located very well. Yes, the rooms were tiny, the toilette was like in a camper (in the double room). But it was clean, good heated and...cheap. We paid 240 EUR for a double room for 3 night (from Friday to Monday)+ English breakfast (354 EUR for a quid). For me it was ok!!! (in center of LONDON!!!). The only "negative side" was the bar where you get the breakfast... lazy!!! Have a nice trip

Reviews.Title: “nothing good to say”
Reviews.Author: nireland65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is advertised as a 3* hotel. This hotel, unfortunately, has nothing in common with what I would expect from a 3* hotel. A number of examples: the reception is tiny, the staff are unfriendly, I was on the 6th floor (they told me I was on the 3rd when I checked in) and there is no lift; the rooms are tiny; no tea/coffee in the room; i woke up with bites of some sorts on my neck, back and legs; there is no shampoo provided in the rooms; there is nothing like an internet service; the TV didnt really work and no satellite channels; hotels.com charged me more than the actual rack rates ...... I could go on and on

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: jrk011
Reviews.Content: You don't expect much from this type of a hotel, and being fair, the room was OK for the price. However, you _do_ expect a minimum of courtesy from the owner/manager, and you don't get that at St. George's. My advice: AVOID. jrk

Reviews.Title: “Very rude Manager, steals money”
Reviews.Author: greenday_keli
Reviews.Content: I called to book a room at this Hotel for the 27th Aug. I later cancelled having realised they were charging me 70 pounds, not 50 per night as adverstised. On July the 31st I noticed that 70 pounds had been taken from my current account by the Hotel. The manager claims I did not show up for the 27th July reservation. He refuses to refund my money, and Citizens Advice Bureau say that if I can't prove I did not make the July booking them it's entirely within the Managers descision. How are you supposed to prove that I booked the August date not July, when I made the booking over the phone. Extremely unpleasant people who answer the phones, they don't like answering queries and god help you if you book direct with them as you don't have a leg to stand on.

HotelInfo.Name: St George's Inn Victoria
HotelInfo.Address: 25 Belgrave Road | Victoria, London SW1V 1RB, England
